content: I'm not sure if this is the right place to post this, but I was curious to know why it doesn't appear to be possible to reorder the list of steams in the lefthand panel on the web / desktop UI? The order in which streams are presented could in and of itself provide context as to importance?

Hi @Alex Claydon, just to mention that you can also pin favorite streamson left side bar.
Also https://github.com/zulip/zulip/issues/10205 tracks similar idea as you suggested.
@Purushottam Tiwari Thank you, I've left a comment on that open issue.

The ability to reorder streams would be useful for conferences that use the Zulip chat for Q&As. Often, streams are created for the conference sessions, in which case a chronological order is better suited than an alphabetical one. For now, we deal with this by pre-pending the streams with suitable unicode characters. Being able to control the order via the API would be nice.
Screenshot_2021-06-03-Virtual-platform.png

@Plankter interesting, thanks for the feedback! This is definitely a case for wanting the organization to control the ordering, not the end user, so that's helpful to think about, since I could imagine a user-centered design here instead. (I suppose you could replace the unicode characters with a number encoding the date, but that doesn't feel super clean either).
